subject: RE: [junit] Concurrent Testing with Unique Data
msgSnippet: I may be mistaken here, but isn t this a design flaw?  If you re hard coding values in your forms, then you re going to get duplicate values when you go live.

I may be mistaken here, but isn't this a design flaw?  If you're hard coding
values in your forms, then you're going to get duplicate values when you go
live.  

You don't say which database you're using, but most proper databases ought
to support TRIGGERs and SEQUENCEs, the proper use of which will resolve your
problem the correct way, by maintaining database uniqueness through database
mechanisms, rather than through the front end.

Cheers, APC

-----Original Message-----
From: margaret.lavin2@... [mailto:margaret.lavin2@...]
Sent: 20 May 2002 13:11
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Concurrent Testing with Unique Data


I've written code to write forms to a Database, each form must have an
individual
Id number, which is hard coded in. Junit is perfect for testing this once.


However if I wish to use a performance test on this (say a JunitPerf, Load
Test to send multiple forms concurrently) this wont work, as the ID numbers
which need too be unique are all the same, so previously exist in the
database,
causing an error.

Is there an aspect of JunitPerf/Junit that allows for multiple test to be
preformed when each individual test involves unique data?

Does anyone know a meethod around this?

Thank you :)
